accessKey.description: Azure Cloud Storage Account Access Key for the container

connectionString.description: Azure Cloud Connection String for the container. Only connectionString or accessKey required
connectionString.title: connectionString

enabled.description: Specifies if you want to use Azure Blob Storage Mlflow Artifact Root
enabled.title: enabled

path.description: Azure blob container folder. If you want to use root level, please don't set anything.

enabled.description: Specifies if you want to use Google Cloud Storage Mlflow Artifact Root

existingSecret.description: Existing secret for AWS IAM user AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY secrets.

name.description: This is for setting up the AWS IAM user secrets existing secret name.
name.title: name

keyOfAccessKeyId.description: This is for setting up the key for AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID secret. If it's set, awsAccessKeyId will be ignored.

keyOfSecretAccessKey.description: This is for setting up the key for AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY secret. If it's set, awsSecretAccessKey will be ignored.
keyOfSecretAccessKey.title: keyOfSecretAccessKey

enabled.description: Specifies if you want to use AWS S3 Mlflow Artifact Root
enabled.title: enabled

path.description: S3 bucket folder. If you want to use root level, please don't set anything.
path.title: path

databaseConnectionCheck.title: databaseConnectionCheck

extraArgs.description: A map of arguments and values to pass to the `mlflow server` command. Keys must be camelcase. Helm will turn them to kebabcase style.
extraArgs.title: extraArgs

extraContainers.description: Extra containers for the mlflow pod
extraContainers.title: extraContainers

MLFLOW_GCS_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT.description: Sets the standard timeout for transfer operations in seconds (Default: 60). Use -1 for indefinite timeout.
MLFLOW_GCS_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT.title: MLFLOW_GCS_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT

MLFLOW_GCS_UPLOAD_CHUNK_SIZE.description: Sets the standard upload chunk size for bigger files in bytes (Default: 104857600 ≙ 100MiB), must be multiple of 256 KB.
MLFLOW_GCS_UPLOAD_CHUNK_SIZE.title: MLFLOW_GCS_UPLOAD_CHUNK_SIZE

MLFLOW_GCS_DOWNLOAD_CHUNK_SIZE.description: Sets the standard download chunk size for bigger files in bytes (Default: 104857600 ≙ 100MiB), must be multiple of 256 K
MLFLOW_GCS_DOWNLOAD_CHUNK_SIZE.title: MLFLOW_GCS_DOWNLOAD_CHUNK_SIZE

extraFlags.description:
A list of flags to pass to `mlflow server` command
Items must be camelcase. Helm will turn them to kebabcase style.
extraFlags.title: extraFlags

extraVolumeMounts.description: Extra Volume Mounts for the mlflow container
extraVolumeMounts.title: extraVolumeMounts

fullnameOverride.description: String to override the default generated fullname

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.

resources.description: This block is for setting up the resource management for the pod more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/
resources.title: resources

securityContext.description: Security context for the mlflow container
securityContext.title: securityContext

enabled.description: Specifies if you want to create a service
enabled.title: enabled

type.description: Specifies what type of Service should be created
type.title: type

enabled.description: Specifies if you want to enable mlflow logging
enabled.title: enabled

telemetry.description: Mlflow Usage Tracking settings. More information can be found here: https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/community/usage-tracking/

enabled.description: Specifies if you want to enable collecting anonymized usage data about how core features of the platform are used.
enabled.title: enabled

telemetry.title: telemetry

annotations.description:
Annotations to add to the service account. AWS EKS users can assign role arn from here.
Please find more information from here:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/specify-service-account-role.html
annotations.title: annotations

automount.description: Automatically mount a ServiceAccount's API credentials?
automount.title: automount

create.description: Specifies whether a ServiceAccount should be created
create.title: create

name.description:
The name of the ServiceAccount to use.
If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template
name.title: name

enabled.description: When set true then use a ServiceMonitor to configure scraping
enabled.title: enabled

interval.description: Set how frequently Prometheus should scrape
interval.title: interval

labels.description: Set labels for the ServiceMonitor, use this to define your scrape label for Prometheus Operator
labels.title: labels

metricRelabelings.description: Set of rules to relabel your exist metric labels
metricRelabelings.title: metricRelabelings

namespace.description: Set the namespace the ServiceMonitor should be deployed
namespace.title: namespace

targetLabels.description: Set of labels to transfer on the Kubernetes Service onto the target.
targetLabels.title: targetLabels

useServicePort.description: When set true then use a service port. On default use a pod port.
useServicePort.title: useServicePort

strategy.description: This will set the deployment strategy more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/deployment/#strategy
strategy.title: strategy

tolerations.description: Set the tolerations for the pod.
tolerations.title: tolerations

autoscaling.description: Autoscaling settings. Can be enabled only when backendStore is not sqlite and artifactRoot is one of blob storage systems.

enabled.description: If true, the number of replicas will be automatically scaled based on default metrics. On default, it will scale based on CPU and memory. For more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/autoscaling/
enabled.title: enabled

metrics.description: The metrics to use for autoscaling.

behavior.description: The behavior of the autoscaler. Only supported on K8s 1.18.0 or later.

scaleUp.description: The behavior of the autoscaler when scaling up.

stabilizationWindowSeconds.description: Time in seconds to wait before scaling up again (default: 0)

type.description: Type of scaling policy: Pods (fixed number) or Percent (percentage of current replicas)

value.description: The value to scale by (number of pods or percentage)

periodSeconds.description: Time in seconds over which the policy is evaluated

policies.description: List of scaling policies for scale-up

selectPolicy.description: Policy to select among multiple policies: Max (default), Min, or Disabled

scaleDown.description: The behavior of the autoscaler when scaling down.

stabilizationWindowSeconds.description: Time in seconds to wait before scaling down again (default: 300)

type.description: Type of scaling policy: Pods (fixed number) or Percent (percentage of current replicas)

value.description: The value to scale by (number of pods or percentage)

periodSeconds.description: Time in seconds over which the policy is evaluated

policies.description: List of scaling policies for scale-down

selectPolicy.description: Policy to select among multiple policies: Max (default), Min, or Disabled

autoscaling.title: autoscaling

allOf.description: Ensures only one of backendStore.postgres.enabled, backendStore.mysql.enabled, postgresql.enabled can be true, or mysql.enabled can be true
